channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report E-2023020450
item.description:
Report E-2023020450

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-15T09:08:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-21
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UBU experienced a UN1760 Liquid Acid Descaler release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor due to a bad seal/fault lid. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail and impacted absorbents were placed into a 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023020247
item.description:
Report X-2023020247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-23
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was sitting outside QA work area in a plastic bag when I showed for work 1/23/2023 @ 330 am. I then doned my PPE and placed package inside a hazmat tote. Upon my inspection I found inadequate inner packing material which caused the can to dent, in turn causing the lid to unseal and product to spill out. DescribePack: loose lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in proper hazmat tote and thick hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2022120513
item.description:
Report X-2022120513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-14
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: when gathering repack packages from the unload, during below freezing temperatures outside, this package was places on the repack cart inside a hazmat tote with bag. Upon my inspection I found that the bubble wrap inside the box had deflated and also the lid on the plastic bottle had come unscrewed. I then printed the sds for the product, doned the proper PPE, and inspected further. At that time I found that roughly 1 liter of the product had leaked out. DescribePack: loose screw on cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package is placed in hazmat bag and tote

item.title: Report I-2022120061
item.description:
Report I-2022120061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-13
  • City: Logan
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MONTANA RAIL LINK
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:30 in September 13, 2022 car UTLX 208497 was identified by the local Trainmaster to have a leak from the top of the car. MRL Mechanical was notified and dispatched a HazMat Technician from Laurel, MT. The HazMat Technician arrived on scene at approximately 12:20 and inspected the car. A manway bolt was found to be less than tool tight. The Hazmat Technician verified the gasket was in working order and the manway bolt was tightened at 13:15.

item.title: Report E-2022090545
item.description:
Report E-2022090545

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-30
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal USB contacted ERTS to report a 5 gallon spill of UN3264 "Ferric Sulfate Solution" corrosive liquid, acidic, inorganic, nos that spilled from a plastic 330 gallon tote. ERTS dispatched Hanser's Environmental to complete clean-up/tote transfer. At 2330 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of product released to a 1' x 2' area of the dock floor due to a puncture. The material remaining in the damaged tote was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all waste into a 30 gallon and 95 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING DURING SORT OPERATIONS. INNER CONTENTS: 2 GLASS BOTTLES/AMPOULES, BOTH WERE IN PLASTIC BAGS WITH ABSORBENT MATERIAL. THE SHIPMENT WAS PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM AND HELD PENDING DISPOSITION FROM THE SHIPPER.

item.title: Report X-2022081079
item.description:
Report X-2022081079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-29
  • City: GREAT FALLS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 204218 was found in the Great Falls yard to be leaking product from the combination housing. Upon inspection, it was noted that the liquid valve was less than tool-tight on the threaded nipple on the pressure plate. The reasoning behind this is that the handle for the valve would not allow for the combination housing cover to close if tool-tightened properly. The valve was removed, the threads re-taped and the valve tool-tightened. The valve handle was removed and zip-tied inside the combination housing.

item.title: Report X-2022060678
item.description:
Report X-2022060678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-27
  • City: KALISPELL
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX GROUND PACKAGE SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH NOTIFIED MGMT OF LEAKING HAZMAT, MGMT AND QA GATHERED NECCESARY SAFETY EQUIPMENT TO SAFELY REMOVE DMG FROM TRUCK. QA TESTED THE PH LEVEL BEOFRE USING A NEUTRALIZING SORBENT AND ABSORBENT PADS TO SOAK UP SPILL, PKG WAS TRANSFERRED TO A TOTE WITH ABSORBENT PADS ON THE BOTTOM OF TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE DESIGNATED HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA. LEAKING PKG WAS DISCOVERED 06/27/2022 AT 6:47 AM DescribePack: GALLON JUG OF ETHANOL WAS INITIALLY PACKED IN A ZIP LOCK BAG BEFORE BEING PACKED INTO THE SHIPPING BOX. THE LID ON THE BOTTLE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN COMPROMISED RESULTING IN MOST OF THE PRODUCT TO LEAKING IN THE ZIP LOCK BAG, UNFORTUNATELY SOME PRODUCT STILL LEAKED INTO BOX AND A SMALL AMOUNT ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRUCK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS CONTAINED IN A HAZMAT BAG WITH ABSORBENT PADS AND KEPT IN A TOTE

item.title: Report E-2022060279
item.description:
Report E-2022060279

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-13
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UBG. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of AggreGloss J25LVOC were released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3178584. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2022060083
item.description:
Report E-2022060083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-14T21:08:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-17
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO logistics terminal UBG reported 1-cup of UN3260 "ACID-ALL" released on the dock floor from 55-pound paper bag that was torn in transit. ERTS dispatched Hanser's Environmental to conduct all onsite cleanup operations. At 1221 ET Hanser's personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to 4' x 4' area of the concrete dock floor. Contractors collected and containerized the damaged bag and all clean up debris into (1) 35-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
